noun.description: The action of shooting at someone from a hiding place, especially accurately and at long range.
examples: sniping assumed great importance during WWI, especially where trench warfare was prevalent

noun.description: The action of verbally attacking someone in a sly or petty way.
examples: there has been some sniping about inept leadership

noun.description: (in an online auction) the action or practice of placing a bid judged to be high enough to win an item just before the bidding is scheduled to close.
